intro: Jasione corymbosa f. pallida, commonly known as the pale-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its pale blue to white flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a delicate and ornamental appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or meadows. It has lance-shaped leaves and a short, upright stem. This variety is valued for its aesthetic appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its charming blossoms.
